The Celtics asked a Federal Court in Boston yesterday to prevent Brian Shaw from playing another season for an Italian team after an arbitrator confirmed the validity of a contract signed by the guard with the Celtics over the winter.

According to the court filing, Shaw informed the Celtics by a letter dated June 6 that he had decided to honor the second year of his contract with Il Messaggero Roma, the Italian team he had signed with after playing for the Celtics in the 1988-89 season. Shaw was the Celtics' top draft pick in 1988.
In February it was announced that Shaw had signed a multiyear contract with the Celtics starting with the 1990-91 season.(AP) SPORTS PEOPLE: PRO BASKETBALL
